result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M. Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Def from PCJ

01:07 15CM241 also at this time. Defendant Kevin M. Robinson in court VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Lynne McMullen.  Defendant Kevin M. Robinson in custody. Judge Boles appears via phone. Court informs defendant of right to be present in the court room and to have Judge Boles present, defendant wishes to waive those rights.  Court accepts waiver.   William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: 15CM87 will amend to disorderly conduct, class B misd, impose time served (Thorie to file amended complaint) 15CM241 plead to count 1--time served, count 2 dismissed. Atty McMullen addresses time served, 15 days on 15CM87, 13 days on 15CM241.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to amended count 1 disorderly conduct in 15CM87,  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 in 15CM87, court dismisses count 2.  Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of amended count 1, disorderly conduct, in 15CM87 and count 1 in 15CM241. Parties address the court, defendant addresses the court. Court orders time served on 15CM87, 15 days. Court orders time served on 15CM241, 13 days. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 01:23
Lynne McMullin

03:34 15CM87 also at this time. Defendant Kevin M. Robinson in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ. Atty Liesl Nelson in court for the defendant. Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson--defendant here on a detainer. Sticht, $250 cash bond on each case. Court qushes warrants in each case, orders $250 cash bond on 15CM241, $250 cash bond on 15CM87. 03:39  Plea hearing scheduled for January 18, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on January 18, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

4:21 Defendant Kevin M. Robinson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to charge. Thorie: $1000 signature bond. Nelson has no objection. This will be a PD case. Def has not been in the armed services.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
